result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:18 AM  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael C. Annis appeared by Zoom videoconferencing.  Attorney Liesl E. Court questions Defendant's address.  Adjourned at 11:20 PM

11:01 AM  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael C. Annis appeared by Zoom videoconferencing.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson appeared by Zoom videoconferencing for Michael C. Annis.  S/T Prescott Chief Eric Michaels.  Direct by DA Hatch.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Nelson.  Redirect by DA Hatch.  Officer released.  State requests probable cause finding and bind over, states argument.  Atty. Nelson states no argument for today's purposes.  Court makes findings; finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

AM Defendant Michael C. Annis appears in Court, Atty Liesl Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions of  no contact w/ KLA and fingerprints/photos , no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. Court adjourned at 9:46 am.
